Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2008 06:34PM Sewfinegirl wrote: My sis had a bilateral with reconstruction on July 21 and came home with four drains. She had a Breast Patient Navigator who gave the best advice for everything. She suggested that my sister use a sink full of water with two large capfulls of Listerene in it and do a sponge bath. It was quite refreshing and because it has an aneseptic it was also good for sanitizing and keeping down bacteria. We were told absolutely not to shower until drains were out. 10 days post-op and all four drains were gone. God is Able!
Posts.Title: showering with drains HeatherL PhyllisCC

Posts.Content: Sewfinegirl wrote: My SIL's husband just lost his job and insurance benefits as of 9-30-09. She is Stage IV, HER2 +, bone mets, lung mets, liver mets. Re-occurence in July 2007. She has to have her Herceptin treatments. Today she had to miss a treatment because of no insurance. $6500.00 every three weeks is hard to come by. Does anyone know where we can get some help? Medicaid has a program for BC and cervical cancer patients only but she was denied. HELP! She reallyÂ  needs this treatment. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Suddenly NO Insurance/ NO TREATMENTS Sewfinegirl concernedsis
